item.title: Zip line platform, 18th August
item.description:
Zip line platforms are rotten and dangerously loose with metal and wood splitters.

item.title: South west end Donaldson Road, 18th August
item.description:
Street needs sweeping. Gutters so rarely done that there is a one foot high Buddlia growing in the side of the road by the kerb. Dogs mess bags among the piles of leaves.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Brondesbury Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Car abandoned outside my house, 18th August
item.description:
This car has been outside our house for around 4 weeks. On investigating via DVLA, the car has road tax to 1st October, but its MOT expired on 13th July. I would like the car removed asap - our street is always full with parked cars & this vehicle is occupying precious parking space.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 46, Arrol Road, Anerley, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing basketball hoops from court, 18th August
item.description:
Hi there, there have been no hoops on the two basketball for more than six months now. Over summer when the kids need to go out and play they can't use these facilities. It is disgraceful that this has been left for so long. The area and it's facilities have been ignored and it is shameful that this is not fixed sooner.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Garnies Close, Peckham, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish left by tenants moving out, 18th August
item.description:
The tenants at 4 Rye Road moved out on 17th August and left rubbish on the footpath in front of the house, as well as across the street under the Lift Academy sign, and further down between 2 green utility boxes next to the academy. They also left rubbish around the corner on Stuart Road at the intersection of Rye Road (SW corner). I saw them moving out throughout the weekend of 16-17 August and saw the items in question among their belongings. They moved them around to other locations when they left to make it look like street litter. This has been going on since 17 August.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 50, Stuart Road, Nunhead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Graffiti at The Falcon Pub, 314 Kilburn Lane

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Kilburn Lane, Kilburn, London

item.title: Smelly, sewage water, absolutely horrendous smell needs to be addressed, 18th August
item.description:
Someone has fly tipped and item carrying smelly, Unsafe water, it has spilled out into the road and now it is just sitting outside. This is a health and safety concern, especially for older people, animals or children that could fall into this Unsafe water. It has been here a couple of days but nothing has been done about it. Please sort this ASAP, this is a serious breach of health and safety! Especially if someone falls into the foul smelling water.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Credon Road, Bermondsey, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Court lines have rubbed off, 18th August
item.description:
The basketball court painted lines have rubbed away. This would be really helpful as we are using chalk to try to maker it out so we can play a proper game
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Oaks, Southborough, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The stretch of thicket road is filthy, 18th August
item.description:
The stretch of road between the currently closed thicket road entrance and the Penge entrance is littered with fly tipped waste, leaves, bottles, dog poo and god knows what else. Why is this road not cleaned twice per week? This is also made worse by the fact the thicket road entrance is closed so there is a lot more footfall along this stretch to the only other gate this side of the park. It’s absolutely shameful that this is the state visitors to the areas see. What is the councils neighbourhood team playing at here? Has anyone gone to look at this stretch of road recently. Only made worse by local events and insufficient cleaning. Complete lack of accountability
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Thicket Road, Crystal Palace, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree roots impacting pavement, 18th August
item.description:
There is a tree outside my house 41 York road, N11 2TH, and it is causing the paving slabs to lift and the tarmac is cracking and extending into a very uneven lumpy surface. It is an accident waiting to happen and is unacceptable to have such a trip hazard in the road. The tree has overgrown and has not been pruned since it was planted in 2009.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oak Lane, London
Report on FixMyStreet
